item.title: Reusable Django Admin Filters
item.author: Mackenzie Morgan
item.description: It’s fairly common to have a many-to-many connection to a User model. But sometimes, you have a lot of users in that table. Problem 1: relations to large tables are unwieldy If we let the Django Admin load every single user into the dropdown in the Django Admin, it’s unusable. The dropdowns are too long. item.title: Django Admin color picker
item.author: Mackenzie Morgan
item.description: When I add a new model to the Django app at work, I try to make sure the results in the Django admin have good usability, too. Just because it’ll be mainly developers (and a few project managers) seeing it doesn’t mean I can neglect usability. Consequently, I spend some time on hacking the Django admin. My manager says I’ve been making it do things he didn’t even realize were possible.
